column2: taxes were not paid with money. They were paid in products and services. Presents and taxes had to be given to the lords by their vassals. At harvest time
column3: the vassals gave shares of their crops to the lords. The vassals would grind their grain at the noble's granaries. They would give part of the grain to their lord. When animals were killed for food
column4: part of the meat was given to the lords. The lords promised to give protection
column6: and safety to their vassals.Manors were completely owned by the nobles. They were given from one generation to another. The noble's firstborn son took it all when his father died. Each manor had its own pasture lands
column10: and village. A manor had to let many people live there. Lords gave their servants food and a place to sleep
column11: but they did not pay their servants money.
